message.content:
cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.DM, cs.SI, cs.IT. 

The paper deals with the problem of removing features from a Bayesian network classifier while maintaining its classification behavior. This falls under the domain of machine learning and data mining, which are covered by the sub-categories cs.LG and cs.DM. The paper proposes a new metric and algorithm for feature selection, which involves optimization and search techniques, and thus can be categorized under cs.AI. The paper also discusses the effect of trimming on the robustness and accuracy of the classifier, which relates to the sub-categories cs.SI (systems and control) and cs.IT (information theory).
